info.title: OpenStreetMap Nominatim API
info.description:
OpenStreetMap Nominatim API v4.2.3

Need some help?
[nominatim.org](https://nominatim.org/)

get.summary: Look up a location from a textual description or address

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Free-form query string to search for. Free-form queries are processed first left-to-right and then right-to-left if that fails. Commas are optional, but improve performance by reducing the complexity of the search.

parameters.name: amenity
parameters.description: Name and/or type of POI. Do not combine with `q=<query>` parameter.

parameters.name: street
parameters.description: Name of street with optional housenumber. Do not combine with `q=<query>` parameter.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: Name of city. Do not combine with `q=<query>` parameter.

parameters.name: county
parameters.description: Name of county. Do not combine with `q=<query>` parameter.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Name of state. Do not combine with `q=<query>` parameter.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Name of country. Do not combine with `q=<query>` parameter.

parameters.name: postalcode
parameters.description: Postalcode. Do not combine with `q=<query>` parameter.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format of response. See [Place Output Formats](https://nominatim.org/release-docs/develop/api/Output/) for details on each format. If not specified, it is equal to `jsonv2`.

parameters.name: json_callback
parameters.description: Wrap JSON output in a callback function (JSONP) i.e. <string>(<json>). Only has an effect for JSON output formats.

parameters.name: addressdetails
parameters.description: Include a breakdown of the address into elements.

parameters.name: extratags
parameters.description: Include additional information in the result if available, e.g. wikipedia link, opening hours.

parameters.name: namedetails
parameters.description: Include a list of alternative names in the results. These may include language variants, references, operator and brand.

parameters.name: accept-language
parameters.description: Preferred language order for showing search results, overrides the value specified in the [Accept-Language HTTP header](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Accept-Language). Either use a standard RFC2616 accept-language string or a simple comma-separated list of language codes.

parameters.name: countrycodes
parameters.description: Limit search results to one or more countries. `<countrycode>` must be the [ISO 3166-1alpha2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) code. Each place in Nominatim is assigned to one country code based on OSM country boundaries. In rare cases a place may not be in any country at all, for example, in international waters.

parameters.name: exclude_place_ids
parameters.description: If you do not want certain OSM objects to appear in the search result, give a comma separated list of the `place_ids` you want to skip. This can be used to retrieve additional search results. For example, if a previous query only returned a few results, then including those here would cause the search to return other, less accurate, matches (if possible).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned results.

parameters.name: viewbox
parameters.description: The preferred area to find search results. Any two corner points of the box are accepted as long as they span a real box. In `viewbox=<x1>,<y1>,<x2>,<y2>` x is longitude, y is latitude.

parameters.name: bounded
parameters.description: When a viewbox is given, restrict the result to items contained within that viewbox (see above). When `viewbox` and `bounded=1` are given, an amenity only search is allowed. Give the special keyword for the amenity in square brackets, e.g. `[pub]` and a selection of objects of this type is returned. There is no guarantee that the result is complete.

parameters.name: polygon_geojson
parameters.description: Output geometry of results as a GeoJSON.

parameters.name: polygon_kml
parameters.description: Output geometry of results as a KML.

parameters.name: polygon_svg
parameters.description: Output geometry of results as a SVG.

parameters.name: polygon_text
parameters.description: Output geometry of results as a WKT.

parameters.name: polygon_threshold
parameters.description: Return a simplified version of the output geometry. The parameter is the tolerance in degrees with which the geometry may differ from the original geometry. Topology is preserved in the result.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: If you are making large numbers of request please include an appropriate email address to identify your requests. See Nominatim's [Usage Policy](https://operations.osmfoundation.org/policies/nominatim/) for more details.

parameters.name: dedupe
parameters.description: Sometimes you have several objects in OSM identifying the same place or object in reality. The simplest case is a street being split into many different OSM ways due to different characteristics. Nominatim will attempt to detect such duplicates and only return one match unless this parameter is set to 0.

parameters.name: debug
parameters.description: Output assorted developer debug information. Data on internals of Nominatim's Search Loop logic, and SQL queries. The output is (rough) HTML format. This overrides the specified machine readable format.

get.summary: Generates an address from a coordinate given as latitude and longitude
get.description: Returns exactly one result or an error when the coordinate is in an area with no OSM data coverage.

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: Latitude of a coordinate in WGS84 projection.

parameters.name: lon
parameters.description: Longitude of a coordinate in WGS84 projection.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format of response. See [Place Output Formats](https://nominatim.org/release-docs/develop/api/Output/) for details on each format. If not specified, it is equal to `xml`.

parameters.name: json_callback
parameters.description: Wrap JSON output in a callback function (JSONP) i.e. <string>(<json>). Only has an effect for JSON output formats.

parameters.name: addressdetails
parameters.description: Include a breakdown of the address into elements.

parameters.name: extratags
parameters.description: Include additional information in the result if available, e.g. wikipedia link, opening hours.

parameters.name: namedetails
parameters.description: Include a list of alternative names in the results. These may include language variants, references, operator and brand.

parameters.name: accept-language
parameters.description: Preferred language order for showing search results, overrides the value specified in the [Accept-Language HTTP header](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Accept-Language). Either use a standard RFC2616 accept-language string or a simple comma-separated list of language codes.

parameters.name: zoom
parameters.description: Level of detail required for the address. This is a number that corresponds roughly to the zoom level used in XYZ tile sources in frameworks like Leaflet.js, Openlayers etc. In terms of address details the zoom levels are as follows: 3) country, 5) state, 8) county, 10) city, 12) town / borough, 13) village / suburb, 14) neighbourhood, 15) any settlement, 16) major streets, 17) major and minor streets, 18) building

parameters.name: layer
parameters.description: The layer filter allows to select places by themes, a comma-separated list of `address` (all places that make up an address: address points with house numbers, streets, inhabited places like suburbs, villages, cities, states, and administrative boundaries), `poi` (all points of interest like restaurants, shops, hotels but also less obvious features like recycling bins, guideposts or benches), `railway` (infrastructures like tracks), `natural` (feautures like rivers, lakes and mountains), `manmade` (catch-all for features not covered by the other layers).

parameters.name: polygon_geojson
parameters.description: Output geometry of results as a GeoJSON.

parameters.name: polygon_kml
parameters.description: Output geometry of results as a KML.

parameters.name: polygon_svg
parameters.description: Output geometry of results as a SVG.

parameters.name: polygon_text
parameters.description: Output geometry of results as a WKT.

parameters.name: polygon_threshold
parameters.description: Return a simplified version of the output geometry. The parameter is the tolerance in degrees with which the geometry may differ from the original geometry. Topology is preserved in the result.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: If you are making large numbers of request please include an appropriate email address to identify your requests. See Nominatim's [Usage Policy](https://operations.osmfoundation.org/policies/nominatim/) for more details.

parameters.name: debug
parameters.description: Output assorted developer debug information. Data on internals of Nominatim's Search Loop logic, and SQL queries. The output is (rough) HTML format. This overrides the specified machine readable format.

get.summary: Query the address and other details of one or multiple OSM objects like node, way or relation
get.description: Returns the details of an OSM object.

parameters.name: osm_ids
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of OSM ids each prefixed with its type, one of node(N), way(W) or relation(R). Up to 50 ids can be queried at the same time.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format of response. See [Place Output Formats](https://nominatim.org/release-docs/develop/api/Output/) for details on each format.

parameters.name: json_callback
parameters.description: Wrap JSON output in a callback function (JSONP) i.e. <string>(<json>). Only has an effect for JSON output formats.

parameters.name: addressdetails
parameters.description: Include a breakdown of the address into elements.

parameters.name: extratags
parameters.description: Include additional information in the result if available, e.g. wikipedia link, opening hours.

parameters.name: namedetails
parameters.description: Include a list of alternative names in the results. These may include language variants, references, operator and brand.

parameters.name: accept-language
parameters.description: Preferred language order for showing search results, overrides the value specified in the [Accept-Language HTTP header](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Accept-Language). Either use a standard RFC2616 accept-language string or a simple comma-separated list of language codes.

parameters.name: polygon_geojson
parameters.description: Output geometry of results as a GeoJSON.

parameters.name: polygon_kml
parameters.description: Output geometry of results as a KML.

parameters.name: polygon_svg
parameters.description: Output geometry of results as a SVG.

parameters.name: polygon_text
parameters.description: Output geometry of results as a WKT.

parameters.name: polygon_threshold
parameters.description: Return a simplified version of the output geometry. The parameter is the tolerance in degrees with which the geometry may differ from the original geometry. Topology is preserved in the result.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: If you are making large numbers of request please include an appropriate email address to identify your requests. See Nominatim's [Usage Policy](https://operations.osmfoundation.org/policies/nominatim/) for more details.

parameters.name: debug
parameters.description: Output assorted developer debug information. Data on internals of Nominatim's Search Loop logic, and SQL queries. The output is (rough) HTML format. This overrides the specified machine readable format.

get.summary: Report on the state of the service and database
get.description: Returns the state of the service.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Selects the output format. See [Status Output Formats](https://nominatim.org/release-docs/develop/api/Status/#output) for details on each format. If not specified, it is equal to `text`.

200.description: If `format` is `json` always returns a HTTP code 200, when the status call could be executed.

get.summary: Show all details about a single place saved in the database
get.description: This API endpoint is meant for visual inspection of the data in the database, mainly together with Nominatim-UI. The parameters of the endpoint and the output may change occasionally between versions of Nominatim. Do not rely on the output in scripts or applications.

parameters.name: osmtype
parameters.description: The type is one of node (N), way (W) or relation (R).

parameters.name: osmid
parameters.description: The id must be a number.

parameters.name: class
parameters.description: The class parameter is optional and allows to distinguish between entries, when the corresponding OSM object has more than one main tag. For example, when a place is tagged with tourism=hotel and amenity=restaurant, there will be two place entries in Nominatim, one for a restaurant, one for a hotel. You need to specify class=tourism or class=amentity to get exactly the one you want. If there are multiple places in the database but the class parameter is left out, then one of the places will be chosen at random and displayed.

parameters.name: place_id
parameters.description: Place IDs are assigned sequentially during Nominatim data import. The ID for a place is different between Nominatim installation (servers) and changes when data gets reimported. Therefore it cannot be used as a permanent id and shouldn't be used in bug reports.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format of response. See [Place Output Formats](https://nominatim.org/release-docs/develop/api/Output/) for details on each format. If not specified, it is equal to `json`.

parameters.name: json_callback
parameters.description: Wrap JSON output in a callback function (JSONP) i.e. <string>(<json>). Only has an effect for JSON output formats.

parameters.name: addressdetails
parameters.description: Include a breakdown of the address into elements.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: Include a list of name keywords and address keywords in the result.

parameters.name: linkedplaces
parameters.description: Include details of places that are linked with this one. Places get linked together when they are different forms of the same physical object. Nominatim links two kinds of objects together: place nodes get linked with the corresponding administrative boundaries. Waterway relations get linked together with their members.

parameters.name: hierarchy
parameters.description: Include details of places lower in the address hierarchy.

parameters.name: group_hierarchy
parameters.description: The output of the address hierarchy will be grouped by type.

parameters.name: polygon_geojson
parameters.description: Include geometry of result as a GeoJSON.

parameters.name: accept-language
parameters.description: Preferred language order for showing search results, overrides the value specified in the [Accept-Language HTTP header](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Accept-Language). Either use a standard RFC2616 accept-language string or a simple comma-separated list of language codes.

get.summary: List objects that have been deleted in OSM but are held back in Nominatim in case the deletion was accidental
List of broken polygons detected by Nominatim
